args: Damn it all! They got me again!
Someone keeps stealing bread\nfrom my shop!
I thought today would finally be the day\nthat I got my hands on the dirty thief,\nbut they bamboozled me AGAIN!
I've been keeping my eyes peeled,\nbut the SECOND I turn away,\nmy beautiful loaves are gone!
Shopkeep, do you always keep your\nbread products atop this wooden box?
Hmm... These footprints around it...\nThank you. This has been elucidating.
Hey, Heinwald. Did you figure out\nwho stole the bread?
Oh, that? It was a mystery so base\na child could have solved it.
Er, then why didn't you tell the\nshopkeeper your findings?
Um...yeees? I mean, if you know who\nthe thief is, shouldn't we arrest them?
That is what I used to think.\n...Until that moment.
Someday, Heinwald, I would love to\nhave you give me a straight answer.\nWhat moment are you talking about?
This was about...oh, ten years ago?
There was a murder in the manor where\nI lived. Someone killed my father.

He was an aristocrat, and the head of my
noble family, so a thorough investigation
was begun. Nonetheless, they were
unable to solve the crime.
It was quite the curious case,\nso I began my own investigation\nand soon hit upon the culprit.
The man who murdered my father\nwas my elder sister's fiancé.
My father was not a popular man,\nnor was he beloved.
He was a tyrannical lord who brought\ngreat harm to many, and most who\nknew him wanted him dead.
Thus, my sister's fiancé resolved to put\nan end to him for the sake of the people.

But in my stupidity, I saw him not as a
man of justice, but a simple criminal.
Thus, I revealed my findings to the court,
and he soon met the headman's axe.
The next day, my sister took her\nown life in front of his corpse.
I discovered the truth and captured the\ncriminal, but plunged everyone into the\ndepths of misfortune as a result.

However, the lesson I took from this is
complex. Merely allowing evil acts to
slide if they are done for a good reason
is not enough to guarantee happiness.
An appropriate means of dealing with\nthe bread thief must be found. And so...
So this little kid is the bread thief?
He has been hiding inside the wooden box\nupon which the bread is perched.
An unexpected blind spot for the shopkeep,\nwho assumed the thief had been\narriving from somewhere else.
Who the heck are you people?\nI-I'm not giving you my bread!
What gall, refusing to hand over something\nthat you have no claim on to begin with.
What are you going to do with this boy?
We cannot simply let him run off.
You there! Boy! Judging from the quantity\nof bread you've taken, I conclude you are\nnot planning to eat it on your own, yes?
You are clearly stealing in order to\nslake the hunger of another.

...Here. Take this letter of introduction,
go to the manor marked on this map,
and tell them you have been hired on
by the lord of the house.
They will give you good, steady work.\nOh, and I expect you to repay the\nshopkeep in full once you are able.
If you find this disagreeable, I am happy\nto go track down the local magistrate.
You have someone who needs it, clearly.\nTake it to them at once.
Amazing. You knew just what\nsituation the thief was in.
That's why you didn't hand him over to the\nshopkeeper the moment you figured it out.
You not only knew who the culprit was,\nyou knew how to deal with him.
It's nothing quite so praiseworthy.\nThat being said...

I traffic in truth—and in solutions.
However, that does not mean I wish
to subject others to misfortune in
order to see this done.
I never want to experience that again...
